description.narrative: Alliance Healthcare (Private) Limited (AHL or the Company) is a leading healthcare group in Peshawar, Pakistan. AHL was established in 2005 and currently operates a 320-bed flagship tertiary hospital, a medical college, and an institute of health sciences. AHL is also in the process of constructing a 600-bed teaching hospital. The proposed IFC investment will support AHL to further construction of the teaching hospital, invest in growth capital expenditure for its existing facilities, and repay existing debt (the Project).

Project-level impact: (i) expansion of a high-quality provider in an area with few high-quality options for patients, (ii) benefitting the healthcare system by strengthening medical education. Market-level impact: (i) potential for replication of systems by other players in the region leading to higher quality care, and (ii) trained staff going to work in other facilities in the region, thereby strengthening overall quality of care.
